text: RYAN HANSEN, shirtless and lightly perspiring (never sweating), huffs and puffs his way up this iconic "hiking trail in the Hollywood hills, all the while talking direc into his iPhone's Periscope app.

What-what! We got straight up picked up, ya'll! Pilot-to-series, suckas! YouTube Red in da hiz-ouse! Brace yourselves for five -- count ‘em -- FIVE more eps of this bad boy right in your pie whole! Wah-DOOSH! ON SCREEN we see a running commentary from IGS Live watchers: Who are you? -- #WeirdAF -- Don't say hiz-ouse. RYAN (cont'd) YTR guys said there was a "less than normal" viewership loss from this crazy viral twerking grandma video that they linked us to. Less than normal! His words, not mine. Crushing iiiit! (beat) BT-dubs, I just want to thank my co- star, the honorable Detective Jessica Mathers -- she made me better in every scene. You know chemistry is a two way street. And some times there are stop lights and some times there are unprotected left hand turns -- but you just keep going. Because... traffic, right? (faux reflective) But I'm not gonna let this show go to my head. It's all about finding my center. Staying grounded. Staying mindful. That's why I'm out here reconnecting with nature. Ryan pans his camera to show a literal PARADE of SHIRTLES MEN and HALF-NAKED WOMEN with insane bodies all walking u Runyon, taking selfies and shooting videos as they "hike" RYAN (cont'd) It's so real up here away from the hustle and bustle of the "LA scene".  Behind Ryan, a VAMPY GIRL in crazy skimpy booty shorts, holds her phone down below her ass then brings it up to h face where she smiles and gives a peace sign while holdin package of "Flat Tummy Tea" she's hawking. RYAN (cont'd) Awesome tea. Totes works. At the top of Runyon, Ryan pans the hazy skyline, landing back on himself... RYAN (cont'd) Honestly though you guys, I don't know how the writers are gonna improve on the pilot. Such a barn burner. I mean, seriously -- how do you top opening on a dead body?
lying on the living room floor. We're...
Ryan, sporting a very strange 18TH CENTURY ARMY OFFICER'S UNIFORM, kneels into frame.

Two dead bodies. Ryan pulls a pair of sunglasses from his coat, inexplicab putting them on for "dramatic effect". The crime scene has been taped off. A couple of BEAT COPS stand watching as a PHOTOGRAPHER snaps pictures and CORON prepare two gurneys.
What the fuck are you wearing? Ryan spins to see JESSICA MATHERS snapping on a pair of rubber gloves.
I've got an audition later.
Is it to be a talking hand-job? Because you're nailing it.
No. It's for Hamilton, the musical?
Do they serve dinner during it? Mathers pushes past Ryan to take in the dead bodies on th floor.

Haw-haw. No -- it's for the movie version. They're doing like an action re-imagining of it without the songs -- I'm going in for Aaron Burr who's like the co-lead. He was played by a black guy in the original, but he was originally originally a white guy, so like, I'm kinda right for it? But not ina racist way or anything. More like returning to the source material or whatever.
Look at me. Look at my eyes. I literally do not give a fuck. Ryan laughs it off.

Hilarious. Great delivery. Anyhow, I binge-watched that milk commercial like a million times to get inside his head as a character. Doing a deep dive on this one. Pete Berg is directing. I hear all the actors are gonna go through Navy Seal training for it. So cool, right? If I get it, it could like totally change my career. I'm just wearing this period plumage to fully immerse myself in the role. Streep says 80% of acting is wardrobe.
Unfortunately, the other 20% is you. (beat) Now if you wouldn't mind shutting the fuck up so I can do my job.

Our job. For five more episodes. Guaranteed. Partner.  4. Ryan smiles smugly. Mathers sighs, but turns her attentio back to the bodies and we get our first good look at them late twenties, MAN and WOMAN, both dressed like they're going to a Renaissance Fair except, bizarrely, the man's wearing the dress and the woman's wearing the pants and puffy shirt (Seinfeld™). The man has a KNIFE, buried to the hilt, sticking out of chest and the woman's face is nearly purple, a small VIAL rests inches from her lifeless fingers. Mathers looks to the BEAT COP standing nearby...
You first on?
Yeah. (to Ryan) Hey, Ry.
Hey, Frank. What's good?
Same old. They laugh like old pals. Mathers is confused.
You know him?
Who? Frank? Course I do. Everyone knows The Franken-ator. Frankenstein! Ryan and Frank do a fun fist bump thing. Mathers doesn't like it one bit.
You still owe me twenty bucks, Hansen.
No way! You didn't eat the whole thing -- that was the bet! They yuck it up a bit. Clearly, Ryan's a people person an Mathers is deeply annoyed by that.
Hey -- sorry to interrupt international grab-ass hour, but you two mind knocking it the fuck off? Total killjoy. Frank and Ryan straighten up.
Sorry, Detective.
Run it for me.
Happened last night. No sign of forced entry. Nothing missing from the house as far as we can tell. No witnesses. Neighbor found him this morning. Pretty thin.
We got names?
John Smith and Jane Dough.
You haven't ID'd them yet?
No, those are their real names.
God I hate this town. (beat) This his place?
Yeah. She lives off of Melrose.
Do we know what's in the vial?
Not yet. Lab boys are running it now. Ryan nods, faking like he's giving this a lot of thought.
What's your read on this one?
Well...they're dead.
Yeah. Same. Same. (beat) What do you make of their outfits?
Maybe they found out they were auditioning for the same role as you and they killed themselves out of shame.
No chance. These aren't working actors. I'd know. Mathers shakes her head.

Okay, Little Lord Fauntleroy, what you're looking at here is your garden variety murder-suicide, with a sprinkle of "Los Angeles normal" cross-dressing thrown in for funsies. Quick version: yada-yada motivation, she stabs him...
we watch as Jane stabs John in the chest, then slugs back the vial, instantly frothing and clutching her throat.
...then tosses back whatever Hemlock- light is in that vial there to off herself. No forced entry, his blood literally on her hands. Adds up pretty clean.
But that's what bothers me about it. It's too clean. Ryan nearly jumps out of his blouse-pants.
Oh dude! That was sick! Great line. Total trailer moment! (MORE )

RYAN (cont'd) (mimicking her) "It's too clean." So good. Can I give you a note though? I think you could carve it out a little more if you add some space work to it. Check it. Ryan squats by the bodies, putting his sunglasses back on He rises, taking them off as he stares into the distance. RYAN (cont'd) That's what bothers me about it: it's too clean. (breaking) See? Better right? I think you should maybe consider adding a toothpick or a match to your mouth. Like something you're always chewing on? Could be your "thing", plus you know, mouth props.
You're a mouth prop. (moving off) Come on.
Where are we going?
Jane Dough's place to see if we can get some answers. Mathers exits. Ryan calls after her, following...
Ooh! Or a red coffee straw! Like you're trying to quit caffeine, but we never come out and say it -- it's like a mystery! Baller backstory!
Mathers drives, Ryan rides shotgun. He tugs at his collar sweating.
Why don't you take that thing off. It's like 100 degrees out.
Art is suffering.
Especially when you do it.
Make fun, but I'm gonna nail this audition tonight.
Your audition is tonight?
9pm.
They hold auditions that late?

It's kind of an after-hours thing. The assistant associate casting director asked me to come in after they're closed. I guess she doesn't want me to intimidate the other actors. She's even keeping it off the books. Very hush hush.
So...it's a secret audition?

Exactly. I'm pretty much like the Zero Dark Thirty of auditioning -- swoop in at night, kill Osama -- in this case Osama would be the audition, not like a real person -- and get out. (beat) So we better solve this case before 9pm tonight, or you're on your own. Cuz nothing is keeping me from landing this one. (into phone) Siri, set an alarm for 9pm tonight, the moment my life will change forever.
True change comes from within. Ryan scratches his neck...
Seriously though, I think I might be like legit allergic to wool. Are these neck blisters?
A modest duplex off of Melrose. Mathers and Ryan the front door.
So what do we know about this place?
We know she lived here.
Ah. Good. Strong clue.
Just shut up and let me do the talking. Mathers knocks on the door. They wait.
Hey -- you think I should have a badge?
No.
Really?
Yes. Mathers knocks again, louder.
Why?
Because you're a moron and it would be illegal. But mostly the first part.
How am I supposed to give an authentic performance if you guys won't let me have a gun or a badge? approach  10.
I guess you'll just have to rely on the suspension of disbelief.
Huh?
Stay here. I'm gonna take a look around back.
What do I do if someone comes to the door?
Ask ‘em if they want to buy musket insurance.

(90% sure) Ha -- that's not a real thing. With that, Mathers moves off around back leaving Ryan sol on the doorstep. Unable to be alone with his thoughts for more than three seconds, Ryan pulls out his phone. He fucks around with some SnapChat face apps: waggy-tongu dog, squeaky-voiced deer, crying baby. Totally normal. Suddenly, out of the corner of his eye, Ryan spots moveme inside the apartment. He cups his hand to the front windo and sees

clutching a knife, slinking through the empty apartment. Ryan's eyes go wide. RYAN (cont'd) Whaaaa? Suddenly, the bathroom door opens and out steps a stunnin SIX-FOOT BLONDE wrapped in a towel having just gotten out the shower. She puts in her ear buds and moves off, unwitting. The Killer closes in on her. Ryan whisper-screams for Mathers RYAN (cont'd) Mathers! Mathers!  11. Nothing. No answer. The clock is ticking. No time to lose, Ryan breaks into action! Ryan kicks the door and falls backwards eating shit into some ADJACENT SHRUBBERY. He pops up and throws his should into it. Once, twice, thrice -- BOOM -- the door opens an in rushes our hero.

We're hand-held behind the killer as he approaches the girl's back. She unwraps her towel. The Killer raises his knife... ...when suddenly RYAN DIVES AT HIM THROUGH A SIDE DOOR, yelling a warrior's cry...
Clooooooney! ...and tackling the would-be assailant to the ground --
The girl SCREAMS -- spinning to see Ryan standing on top the intruder, clutching the knife.
What the fuck man!? Who are you?!
I'm Ryan Hansen.
Who?
The Nickelodeon Slime-Time nominated actor? I just totally saved your life.
Saved my life? From who?
From like the killer. Duh. On cue, the Killer groans...
Ow! I think you broke my arm, asshole!  12. Ryan looks down and spots the Killer who pulls off his authentic "SCREAM" mask a GoPro strapped to his forehead.

That's my scene partner, douche. We're rehearsing! Just then, Mathers rushes in, gun drawn. BLONDE (cont'd) Whoa -- what the hell?! Mathers takes in the situation, putting it together quick Her shoulders slump. She sighs...
Dingbat -- what the fuck did you do? Ryan looks down at the Killer...
My bad, dawg.
we're watching the GoPro footage. It freezes. We're...
...where we meet our new captain, SHARON JACKSON. [Reader's Note: the precinct is shot in the same faux doc style aesthetic as THE OFFICE. ] Lady Captain Jackson rewinds the tape in disbelief...
Did you really yell "Clooney" before attacking? Mathers and Ryan sit in chairs, hang dog.
George Clooney is my spirit animal.
Well, your spirit animal is about to get the city in a serious god damn lawsuit. That Spielberg Scorsese you assaulted is threatening to sue.  13.
Captain, it was an honest mist--
Nope. Detective. You don't get to talk. You're on thin enough ice as it is.
Honestly, none of this would've happened if I had a badge.
You want a badge? Become a real cop and stop dressing like you're in the Nutcracker.
This is for my Hamilton audition. It's period authentic.
Well, I'm period authentic pissed off.

More genre authentic, but I totally honor that feeling. And before we dialogue further on this, can I just say I think it's such a cool cosmic coincidence that the old Captain Jackson and you share the same last name. Are you guys related?
Why? Because we're both black?
(stunned) You're black? I honestly didn't notice. I don't see color -- just people. And auras. (to Mathers) Did you know she's black? Crazy, right? Mathers looks like she's about to die.
Captain -- I let him out of my sight for two seconds, it was a mistake and it won't happen again. (MORE )
MATHERS (cont'd) We've got a good lead on the case and we'll close it. I promise.
Yeah -- you better close it. And quickly or Vanilla Ice here won't be the only one in this room without a badge. (beat) Now get the hell out of my office. Mathers and Ryan slink out. Ryan whispers...
FYI, I think she meant you on the badge thing. Mathers shoots him a murderous glare.
PARKER STARR, formerly the blonde in the towel, sits opposite Ryan and Mathers...
What do you mean she's dead?
Well I guess I mean it literally.
I don't understand, I just saw Jane yesterday. She was spending the night at John's -- they were gonna rehearse for the showcase tonight.
Showcase?
Yeah -- it's where a bunch of actors do scenes from other plays and movies for casting directors.
I know what a showcase is. I'm an actor.
You keep saying that. Would I have seen you on anything?  15.
This. This show that you're literally on right now.
This is a show? Who's it for?
YouTube Red.
Never heard of ‘em.

No one has. That's the point. My partner and I here are gonna put them on the map. Big time. Kabloom. Emmy. Kabloom Golden Globe. Kabloom other TV award I can't think of right now. Like a SAG or something.
Whatever.
Yeah -- whatever to you. Mathers steps in...
Okay ladies, calm down -- can we just focus here. You said she was preparing for a performance?
Yeah -- they were doing the death scene from Baz Lurhmann's Romeo & Juliet.
That explains the outfits. And they flipped gender roles to keep it fresh. Clever. Makes perfect sense.
None of this makes sense. First of all Romeo & Juliet was written by William Shakespeare.
Technically maybe, but Baz's was like way better than the original. Kinda like Ocean's Eleven. (MORE )

RYAN (cont'd) Pre-Titanic Leo. Post-Catalano, pre- Homeland Danes. So good. Plus, not to make this a history lesson or anything, but that Roland Emmerich movie totally disproved that Shakespeare even ever existed. So... Mathers clenches her jaw, trying to ward off a conniption
Never mind. (to Parker) Please, continue.
Well, they were stressed out about it. I know because we all are. I'm in the class too. Jared and I were rehearsing our scene from Scream before Mr. Hero here "saved the day" and broke Jared's arm.
Allegedly. FYI -- I'm not really approaching my role as a "hero" per se, but more of a troubled protagonist.
That's such an obvious choice. Look, all I'm saying is tonight's gonna be huge. Some big time agents' assistants are gonna be in the crowd.
(intrigued) Really? Like who?
(cutting in) What's the class called?
It's Alfonso Diaphano's exotic scene study and review.
Alfonso Diaphano? That's an actual human being's name?
He's only like one of the best acting teachers east of the 405. (MORE )

RYAN (cont'd) He was Taylor Lautner's on-set coach for like all of the Twilight movies. He teaches at this old school place downtown. His class is impossible to get in to. (to Parker) You must be good.
Better than you.
(aside to Mathers) I don't like her. I think she did it.

Relax. (to Parker) Well, it looks for all the world like your roommate, Jane, stabbed her acting partner in the chest and then swallowed some poison to off herself in the process. Quite the little scene stealer, wouldn't you say?
That doesn't make any sense. (beat) Why would she kill John on the same day he proposed? Ryan and Mathers share a dumbfounded look.
Ryan and Mathers exit the INTERVIEW ROOM and walk toward through the BULLPEN as we track with them. Ryan checks hi phone...

She wasn't lying. Look, Jane updated her Facebook page that morning. JANE DOUGH's Facebook page: a picture of a modest ENGAGEM RING on her hand with the tagline: He asked!!! #HappyWife RYAN (cont'd) I didn't see an engagement ring on her finger.  10 18.
That's because there wasn't one. Mathers mind races. They keep walking. We keep tracking. MATHERS (cont'd) Still doesn't explain why his blood was on her hands. (beat) We're gonna need some answers.
Totally. Ryan's smirking.
What?
We just did our first walk and talk together.
Huh?

This whole thing was just a walk & talk one-er. It's like a way to make boring plot stuff less boring for the audience. They did it all the time on The West Wing (so good right?). See how we just went in like a big circle but nothing really happened-- WHACK -- Ryan walks balls-first into a BANISTER BEAM, doubling over and dropping. Mathers doesn't break stride.
That just did.

The two DEAD BODIES lie on STAINLESS STEEL SLABS as Ryan Mathers get the lowdown from PRIYA DAS (30s) a sober Indi American Medical Examiner. She pulls down her exam mask, revealing a strikingly beautiful face.
We got the lab results back an hour go.  19. Ryan is stunned...
Whoa -- time out -- you're crazy hot.
Excuse me?
No, I mean that in a good way. Plus, your face is like totally diverse.
What the hell does that mean?
I'm just saying you could play a doctor on TV or something.
I'm a doctor in real life.
Yeah -- but you could be one on TV.
Why would I want to do that? Ryan is utterly flummoxed by that response.
Huh?
I'm gonna step in here. What did the labs tell you?
She drank a concentrated form of a chemical compound NaOH.
Sodium Hydroxide. (off Mathers look) I played a "cool" chemistry teacher for a three ep arc on Heart of Dixie season five. No biggie.
He's right. Sodium Hydroxide is the active ingredient in Drano. Highly corrosive. She basically chugged acid.  20.
Ugly way to go. What about the blood on her hands?
We tested it and it isn't his and it's not hers either.
Oh shit -- is it alien blood?
Ignore him. I don't follow. You're saying there was a third party?
No. I'm saying it's not anyone's blood. Because it's not blood at all.
It's stage blood.
Corn syrup and red food coloring. To prove her point, Priya runs her gloved finger along th "blood" on Jane, licking it. Ryan gags. PRIYA DAS (cont'd) Your partner's correct.
We're not partners. He's a sanctioned civilian observer.
I'm getting a badge.
No he's not.
It's being discussed.
(to Priya) I don't understand, why would she bother with stage blood if she was gonna stab him anyway? Priya picks up an EVIDENCE BAG holding the KNIFE.  Mathers just 21.
This is a prop knife. The blade is suppose to retract on impact, but someone blocked the mechanism inside of it, locking it in place.
So this wasn't a murder-suicide.
This was a murder-murder sitch. stares at Ryan.
Seriously? What's wrong with you?
What? I'm sorry I don't know the fancy term, okay? It's only the second episode. We need a technical adviser on this show.
I swear to god I'm not gonna make it. Look, Streisand, this means there's a killer out there and we've gotta find him.

(proudly correcting) Or her. It could be a her -- women can be murderers too. They're just as good at killing as men are. Equality, you know? I'm with her. Ryan shoots the camera a little "you're welcome" glance.
Let's go.
Where to?

Whoever fixed the prop knife also clearly replaced the fake poison in her vial with the real stuff. And whoever did that, had to know that they were doing that particular scene for the showcase -- which means the killer is in that stupid acting class.  22.
Whoa -- that was awesome. You're like the first half of A Beautiful Mind.
Come on, we don't have a lot of time.
One sec... Ryan turns to Priya... RYAN (cont'd) Hey Doc Bollywood, I've got some light smile lines coming in here and here. Can you just hit ‘em real quick before we go.
Are you asking me for Botox?
Just a quick poke-er-roo with the ol' freeze juice and we'll be on our way. We're gonna be on the confessional couch later and that lens can be like super unforgiving.
Are you fucking serious right now?
Oh and she could use it too. Like a lot. Like pretty much everywhere. Hose her down. (stage whisper) She's from Cleveland.
Gross.
Right? 11 EXT. DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER - DAY ll Establishing. I have nothing else to say about this.  12 23.
Mathers and Ryan talk with a scarf-wearing ALFONSO DIAPHA (60s) who flutters about the space getting things ready f the big show tonight. Actors rehearse in the background.
Mr. Diaphano, thanks for the time, is there anyone in the showcase tonight that might've had a reason to dislike Jane or John?

Darling -- try everyone. Jane and John were far and away the best actors in the class and tonight they would've shown it by blowing all the other performers off the stage. I bet half of them are secretly thrilled those two won't be going on tonight. The spotlight, after all, is only so big.
So true. So true.
Do I know you from something?
Probably. I'm Ryan Hansen.
(long beat) Nope. Alfonso moves on, Mathers and Ryan follow.
I'm sorry, you're telling me an actor would kill another actor just for a chance to get noticed? Alfonso looks to Ryan confused. He explains...
She's from Cleveland. Alfonso makes a face like he caught a whiff of something.
I know, I know -- "gross".  24. Suddenly, Alfonso gets a text message. He checks it.

I'm sorry. I must go. Ashton has an on-set scene emergency. They want him to keep his shirt on. The fools. (beat) Good luck finding the "killer" -- so dramatic! With that, Alfonso sashays off. Ryan turns to Mathers.
Look -- there's only one way to solve this crime and catch the killer. You thinking what I'm thinking?
I can promise you I'm not.
(jazz hands) It's a...

...Showcase showdown! On the Modern Family-style confessional couch, Ryan and Mathers address the camera directly. RYAN (cont'd) We're going undercover at tonight's to do. We find that engagement ring, we find the killer. Right, partner?
We're not partners.
You're right. We're not partners. We're more important than that to each other now. We're scene partners.
This is going to be unbearable.  14 15 25.
(excited) I know, right? And I have the perfect scene for us to do together.

location: DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER / STAGE

text: A HALF-FULL AUDIENCE watches Ryan and Mathers, both soaki wet and dressed like McAdams & Gosling from The Notebook, standing center stage. A makeshift "rain machine" offers a two-foot wide deluge directly over Ryan. Mathers gives the stiffest reading imaginable, checking h palm for cribbed lines as she goes.
Why didn't you write me? Why? It wasn't over for me. I waited for you for seven years. And now it is too late. Ryan chews the scenery...
I wrote you 365 letters. I wrote you every day for a year. Mathers misses her cue. Ryan prompts her. She reluctantly obliges...
You wrote me?

Yes. It wasn't over. It still isn't over. Ryan goes to pull Mathers in for the big movie star kiss moment but she quickly pivots and hip-tosses Ryan to the stage in a slick Judu move. Ryan writhes. Mathers bows and gives a genuine smile, pleased with herself. A confused crowd applauds lightly.
Ryan and Mathers come off stage. Ryan is hot...
What the hell was that?  26.
I'm sorry okay? It was a reaction. I thought you were attacking me.
Attacking you?! With my mouth?
How was I supposed to know -- I've never seen the movie, okay?
(horrified) You've never seen The Notebook???
I don't like movies. I find them hard to believe.
I can't even with you. Ryan moves to a WALL OF HEADSHOTS and starts pulling them down, one after the other.
What the hell are you doing?

Our job. These are all the head shots for the actors in the showcase tonight. On the back are their resumes. At the bottom of every acting resume is a little section called, "special skills" which no one ever reads. Except me, right now, because whoever our killer is...
...-has to have a background in Chemistry.

I was gonna say probably studied Meisner. But that could work too. Mathers starts pulling off head shots too. They scan them tossing them aside as they go. Ryan shakes his head... RYAN (cont'd) Seriously -- rollerblading counts?  27.
Hello there. Guess who minored in Organic Chemistry at Baylor? Mathers turns her phone to show Ryan...
Told ya...
wrapped in a robe, putting on make-up in a BACKSTAGE MIRR
.++.women can be killers too. Reveal Ryan and Mathers in the mirror. Parker spins.
Not a lot of six-foot blondes know how to synthesize sodium hydroxide from liquid plumber.
And only one person in Alfonso's class does.
You're under arrest, gigantor.
Honestly -- this all feels a little straight forward to me. I was hoping for more of a twist ending. On cue, a gun slides into frame pointed right at the back Ryan's head.
How's this for a twist? Reveal: JARED, Parker's scene partner from the GoPro shoo
More of a reveal, but I'll take it. Jared, sporting a cast on his broken arm, shoves Ryan and Mathers DEEPER BACK STAGE, away from everyone, as Parker joins his side smiling smugly.  28.
There was no way we were going to let those two steal the show tonight. I'm the one who got Jane into this class in the first place.
So you killed your friend just for a performance?

She wasn't my friend, she was my competition. But that's not why I killed her. Parker pulls on her necklace, revealing Jane's ENGAGEMENT RING. PARKER STARR (cont'd) I killed her because I was in love with her. And if I couldn't have her, no one could.
Oh shit -- lesbian stuff. This is so HBO, I love it. Plus it really connects with our LGBTQ demo.
Oh I get it. You're not "actor crazy" you're just crazy-crazy. What's your plan, sweetheart? Kill us both? Make it look like another murder-suicide?
Why not? After the performance you two gave, anyone would believe you left the stage and immediately killed yourselves.
How dare you. Ryan lunges forward -- Mathers steps in front of him, holding him back. Just then, a CHUBBY DUDE dressed like Uma Thurman from Kill Bill steps in...

Parker, you guys are up next -- whoa.  16 29. He stops short at the sight. Parker and Jared are momentarily distracted. Mathers takes advantage -- knocki the gun from Jared's hand. Instantly, it's chaos -- Ryan grabs for Parker who slips of his grasp leaving him with a handful of terry cloth ro revealing herself to only be wearing skimpy black lace undies and heels. Distracting to say the least. Mathers pulls her gun but is flattened by the Kill Bill D who Jared shoves at her, snatching up his own gun and running toward the stage. Parker takes off in the opposite direction, grabbing the Kill Bill Dude's KATANA SWORD as she goes -- slamming through a door that's marked ROOF ACCESS. Ryan and Mathers pop up together...
You go after him, I'll handle her. Mathers rolls her eyes: typical. RYAN (cont'd) What? She's the one without a gun.
Just go! The partners split up.

location: DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER / STAGE

text: Jared comes rushing out on stage interrupting a very emotional scene from Fast and Furious (apparently Dominic Torretto lives his life a quarter of a mile at a time). Jared leaps from the stage and hurries down the center ai just as Mathers appears from behind the curtain.

Freeze! LAPD! BANG!-BANG! Jared fires a couple of pot-shots before exiting through a SIDE DOOR. Mathers dives out of the way The actors are confused, but crowd loves it, pulling out their phones; filming and posing for "Peace Sign" selfies the action unfolds behind them.  17 18 30. Mathers shakes her heads in disgust as she sprints past these Los Angeles idiots... MATHERS (cont'd) Someone call 911! She pounds through the side door in hot pursuit.

location: DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER / ROOFTOP

text: Ryan pushes through the ACCESS DOOR onto the roof. Steam vents and the downtown skyline give the whole thing a lus LA Noire vibe. Ryan scans the rooftop, no sign of Parker. He pivots back and suddenly ducks, barely avoiding decapitation from the leggy blonde's home run swing -- THWACK! Steam shoots out of a freshly severed pipe as a wild-eyed Parker steps int her light...

You thought I was a guest star on your show?! Wrong! You're just a day player on mine! She attacks, unleashing a flurry of swings as Ryan scramb back narrowly dodging each one. It's an odd, albeit kinda sexy, sight as a six foot model five inch heels, swings a four foot sword in her underwea

(ducking) Don't you think this is a little gratuitous? (ducking) I mean, I can't really tell if this is super misogynistic or like a female empowerment thing? Can you? Another swing sparks off of stone as Ryan jumps out of th way.

location: DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER / ALLEY

text: Jared hustles toward us just as Mathers pops into the all from the side door. He fires at her. She dives for cover.  19 31. He's got her pinned, but Mathers spots something. She fir two precise shots -- clipping a FIRE ESCAPE LADDER just above Jared's head. The heavy iron ladder comes down like guillotine, clonking Jared on the head. Out cold. Mathers rushes up to him, kicking his gun away and cuffin him to the ladder. Then she hears a GIRL SHRIEK. She look up to see Ryan standing on the ledge of the roof, his bac to her.
Shit. She takes off running.

location: DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER / ROOFTOP

text: His Jordan 6's on the edge of the coping, Ryan's out of r estate. Parker smiles...
Any last words? (beat) Wait -- I'm sorry, featured extras aren't allowed to speak. She raises her sword when suddenly...

Wait! Wait -- okay?! Something in Ryan's tone give Parker pause. Gone is his glib charm, this is now something real for him... RYAN (cont'd) I get it. I know why you killed her. I know what it's like to love something that doesn't love you back. (beat) I've been a working actor for over a decade, but most people confuse me with Ryan Phillippe. And I've finally, after all these years, got my own show and it's not even on television. It's on a website that most people think they jerk off to. (beat) I know your pain, Parker. I'm the same as you. We all hurt. Moved by his words, all the fire goes out of Parker, she lowers her sword...  32.
Thank you.
No, thank you. (beat) Can I just ask you one thing?
Sure. What?
Who's your favorite Batman? Huh? Parker doesn't follow. Then we hear the cry...
Clooooney! Parker spins just in time to take a crisp right cross to jaw from Mathers -- CLUNK. The spindly blonde goes down i a heap of knees and elbows, one punch knock out. Ryan looks to Mathers...
Took you long enough.
I didn't want to interrupt your monologue. Mathers cuffs Parker, helping her to her wobbly feet.
Case closed. Cue the sirens. Indeed, the sound of police sirens. Parker scowls at Ryan...
You tricked me!
(big smile) It's called acting, bitch. Look it up. Mathers drags her off. Ryan watches smugly, then...
Your Hamilton audition starts now.  20 33. Ryan curses, he can't believe he forgot. Devastating.
Flashing lights and a lovely little crane shot let us kno that we've reached the aftermath. Parker and Jared are shoved into the back of a waiting sq car as Mathers and Ryan walk toward us...
I'm sorry you missed your big audition.
(glum) Thanks. Mathers tries to buck him up...
Look -- it's an aftermath scene. You love aftermath scenes.
Yeah. I guess so. Just then, a 22 year-old AGENT'S ASSISTANT in a suit approaches gushing over Mathers...
You were incredible! "Freeze LAPD!" Amazing! So authentic! He hands her his card. AGENT'S ASSISTANT (cont'd) I work in Adam Venit's office at WME. Call me, I can get you work tomorrow.
I'm not an actress. I'ma cop.
Method! I love it! Don't change. He moves off. Mathers just shakes her head...
I think he still had his baby teeth. You want this?  21 34. She offers his card to Ryan who shakes his head, defeated
I just wanna go home. Ryan moves off. We hold on Mathers feeling for him.
AMY and Ryan's THREE GIRLS sit at the kitchen table with CRYER, each with multiple devices in front of them (lapto iPhones, iPads, etc.) tapping away feverishly. Ryan's youngest complains...
Mommy, my finger hurts.
I know, honey. Just a couple more hours -- Daddy needs as many clicks as possible for his show to stay on the internet.
I love this -- it's like the cutest little sweatshop ever. The STUDIO AUDIENCE laughs.
Mom -- how come I haven't seen a single ad for stuff I don't want and can't skip on YouTube?
That's because you're not on YouTube -- you're on YouTube Red. YouTube's Premium Subscription Service channel. (to camera) It's a bargain at only $9.99 a month.
Like NetFlix?
Well, they both cost the same.
I wanna watch The Crown.  35.
Well all do, honey. Well all do. Keep clicking.
Hang on -- you guys are on YouTube Red? (realizing) Well, that explains a lot.
What site have you been on this whole time? Amy moves to look at Jon's laptop. He quickly closes it, standing up.

A very different website with a very similar name. But the categories section make a lot more sense now. The audience laughs knowingly. Cryer moves to the door ju as it opens and in walks Ryan. The audience cheers his entrance.
Daddy! All three girls rush their father. He kneels down for a hug. It makes him smile.
We've been clicking on your show to help you stay internet famous, even though we can't watch The Crown on it.
Or Stranger Things.
Or Narcos.
Or House of Cards. The effort melts Ryan.
Aw -- thanks, guys.  36.
Why hello there, white Aaron Burr. How'd the big audition go?
It didn't. I missed it.
You missed it? Oh no -- why?
Because he was helping me solve a case. Mathers enters. The audience cheers. She's still not used to it.
I couldn't have done it without him. Ryan nods a thank you to Mathers.
Well, there will be other auditions.
Not for Hamilton there won't. Byeeee! The crowd laughs as Jon Cryer scoots off waving to them.
That's okay. I don't need Hamilton, I've got you guys. A big family hug. The crowd "Awwws". The hug ends. Ryan turns to Mathers. RYAN (cont'd) See ya tomorrow.

See ya tomorrow. Mathers goes to the door, but stops and turns back. MATHERS (cont'd) Hey Haircut -- Ryan turns. MATHERS (cont'd) Catch.  22 37. Mathers tosses him something. He catches it. Then looks t see it's a SHINY GOLD BADGE.
Are you serious?

It's a meter maid's badge, but I don't think anyone will notice. (then) See you tomorrow...scene partner. It's a warm moment. The crowd reacts appropriately. Ryan smiles. Mathers nods back. Jon Cryer pops back in...
Does anyone know how to clear a browser history? Asking for a friend. The audience laughs. So does everyone on stage. FREEZE. END OF EPISODE.
A VIDEO RECORDING stutters to life as Ryan steps back and takes his mark, addressing the lens.

Ryan Hansen, self-tape audition for the role of Aaron Burr in Hamilton: American Vengeance. Ryan turns left and right, offering profiles. He squares up, takes a breath, then lets it rip. RYAN (cont'd) Too bad, Alexander. When the bomb I've strapped your chest to goes off, your dream of an America with a strong central government goes with it. I guess I, Aaron Burr, am finally in "the room where it happens." (then) What? George Washington? How did you get in here-- NOoooOo! Suddenly, Ryan starts jerk his body all over the place as though he were getting shot to death. In slow motion. Wit sound effects.  38. This goes on for awhile. Ryan finally dies, pulling the backdrop sheet down with h Breathless, he pops back into frame. RYAN (cont'd) And scene.
